result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane R Fitzgerald was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $150 bond applied. $50 per month payment plan commencing on or before March 5, 2015. $15 payment plan fee added

20 DAYS IN MARQUETTE COUNTY JAIL WITH HUBER. 
REPORT ON OR BEFORE MARCH 4, 2016 BY 7:00 P.M., CLEAN & SOBER
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shane R Fitzgerald

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DNA PROOF OF SUBMISSION FROM MASO

Defendant Shane R Fitzgerald in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that he did meet with the defendant and an offer was provided.  In speaking with the defendant before court the defendant would like to accept that offer.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Defendant agrees.   Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant waives their right to an attorney.    Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.    Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Defendant asks for 60 days to report to jail.  Defendant also asks for a payment plan.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders 20 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
  Report on or before March 4, 2016 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
Court Costs - $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
bond to be applied.
 Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan for the balance:  $50.00/month commencing in March

Pre-trial conference at 12-08-2015 10:00 am.
Return date at 01-06-2016 03:30 pm.

Defendant Shane R Fitzgerald in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause.  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
  Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.  Court questions defendant on his waiver and finds it to be made freely, voluntarily and intelligently.
BY THE COURT:  Set for return date and PTC.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
